meanings.definition: A warning or caution to be vigilant and aware of potential dangers.
meanings.sent1: The teacher gave us watchouts about crossing the busy street.
meanings.sent2: Always pay attention to the watchouts posted in the construction zone.
meanings.sent3: The watchouts about eating too much candy were ignored by the mischievous children.
meanings.sent4: His experience with the scam served as a watchout for others to be careful.
meanings.sent5: The watchouts about online privacy were emphasized in the cybersecurity workshop.

meanings.definition: Things to be cautious or careful about.
meanings.sent1: Before hiking in the forest, make sure to review the watchouts provided by the park ranger.
meanings.sent2: The guidebook listed important watchouts for first-time travelers to the city.
meanings.sent3: The watchouts regarding food allergies were crucial for the party planning.
meanings.sent4: She kept a list of watchouts to remember while exploring the unfamiliar neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The watchouts highlighted in the safety manual helped prevent accidents at the workplace.
